dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Tucker b Hume 93 (89b 9x4 0x6 122m) SR: 104.49

dismissalComment.html: Appeal for caught behind is given, Shakib walks! Was a yorker outside off the Shakib tried to dig out with an open face. He was indecisive and the bat face opened and it flicked the bottom of the bat to the keeper. Shakib has to go for 93 after completing 7000 ODI runs

dismissalText.commentary: Towhid Hridoy b Hume 92 (85b 8x4 2x6 138m) SR: 108.23

dismissalComment.html: Searing yorker Slower one denies Hridoy a debut century!. He was on the move and tried to whip it through midwicket with a flourish. Hume's full ball landed on a full length and went through the gap to clatter the stumps.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Stirling b Adair 3 (9b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Caught by Stirling at first slip, and that's that for Tamim. This was pitched up again, swinging away from the batter, and Tamim followed it with a drive, and just managed to get a nick through to Stirling, who catches it smartly knee-high to his right at first slip.

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Stirling b Campher 26 (31b 2x4 1x6 43m) SR: 83.87

dismissalComment.html: Ballooned to cover! Odd dismissal as the length ball gripped in the surface a bit and Litton went through with a back-foot push too early. The bat had an open face, the ball met it low and popped right up. Dolly for Stirling and Campher strikes in his first over.

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Stephen Doheny c Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 34 (38b 4x4 1x6 49m) SR: 89.47

dismissalComment.html: there's a tickle! Fullish ball outside off and Doheny tries to poke at it. But this delivery has skidded through and taken the edge into the keeper's gloves! Doheny knew that was out but looked at the umpire in a hopeful manner. However Mushfiqur and the bowler are celebrating and Doheny knows its best to just start walking

headshotImage.caption: PR Stirling headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: PR Stirling headshot

dismissalComment.html: terrific from the wicketkeeper Mushfiqur! Ebadot goes short on middle. Stirling swivels to pull but the ball gets big on him. He gets a glove and Mushfiqur has to throw his body to the left while sticking his hands out - and voila, he manages to do just that! Mushfiqur goes flying and that's a second brilliant glovework effort to send the other opener back for 22

headshotImage.caption: Harry Tector player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Tector player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: fullish ball outside off. A so-so delivery that was begging to be driven but he lazily reaches out to play at it. Takes the edge, and the keeper effects a third dismissal!

dismissalComment.html: Edges the pull, Mushfiqur takes a catch at head-height. Bouncer follows the batter making room, the 142kph ball is too fast for Adair.

images.caption: Nasum Ahmed took two wickets in two balls
images.longCaption: Nasum Ahmed took two wickets in two balls, Bangladesh vs Ireland, 1st ODI, Sylhet, March 18, 2023

headshotImage.caption: Curtis Campher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Curtis Campher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full ball on off and middle. Gets forward to defend, but the ball goes past the inside edge of the bat and hits his front leg. LBW appeal and given! Ireland review after a short chat. If there is no inside edge, this should be plumb. Campher looked to defend from an off-stump line but the angle of the delivery has made the ball hit him in front of middle. Bat is close to the ball on replay, but the technology doesn't suggest an edge. The TV umpire, though, wants a second angle to rule out bat. He says, "satisfied it is pad first".... and the replay shows the ball crashing into leg stump.

headshotImage.caption: Gareth Delany player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Gareth Delany player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front? Big appeal, finally umpire Tucker raises his finger. Batter went onto the back foot to this fullish ball on middle. Sliding into his pads, and this has hit him in front of middle and leg. Probably clipping leg stump at worst. They choose not to review and Ireland are seven down

headshotImage.caption: AR McBrine headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AR McBrine headshot

dismissalComment.html: coming over the stumps, and this is out down the leg side?! Bangladesh are reviewing. This was a length ball on middle that was turning down leg. But the batter attempted the flick, and the home side feels this is caught behind. Another terrific grab from Mushfiqur, if this is out. Keeper and bowler are convinced. And yes, there is a graze. Umpire Tucker has to change his decision. Nasum with a third!

dismissalComment.html: Yessir, Yasir! Taskin follows the wicket maiden over with another wicket to start his next over. Tucker tucked up by a short-ish ball around off. He wanted to nurdle it leg side but the bat's face is closed, and the edge flies to first slip. Yasir had to move to his right with the ball flying, but he was up to the challenge!

dismissalText.commentary: George Dockrell b Ebadot Hossain 45 (47b 6x4 0x6 72m) SR: 95.74

commentTextItems.html: Yorker at 142kph knocks over leg stump to complete 183-run win! Dockrell made room too early, tried to power a cover drive but it rocked back the stumps.

commentPostTextItems.html: A clinical performance by Bangladesh on a new-look pitch. Ireland had their moments but couldn't string them together to gather momentum or gain an advantage. Can the hosts complete a series win or can the visitors come back to create parity? Join us on Monday to find out. Goodbye for now from me, Ekanth, my co-commentators, Shamya Dasgupta and Sreshth Shah, and our scorer, Thilak.
Aktar: "Mustafiz will have to do exceptionally well to get a spot in playing eleven instead of Hasan and Ebadot since Taskin is number one choice."

Tamim Iqbal, Bangladesh Captain: We batted exceptionally. Wasn't the best wicket to bat in our first 20 overs. Shakib was brilliant. Mushy's innings made the difference, shoutout to him. Very pleased with the way we bowled under lights. I think the wicket was great but could have been better in the first 20-25 overs, when it was on the slower side. But these sporting wickets will help us. He's been doing it for the last 17 years. People forget that there will be ups and downs, he's been amazing. Ebadot is world-class. Special mention to Nasum. He doesn't play too many ODIs but has been brilliant when he in in.
Towhid Hridoy, POTM: Missing the hundred hurts a bit but I am happy to have gotten a great start. I felt good. Shakib bhai gave me a lot of confidence. I just tried execute my plan.

Andy Balbirnie, Ireland Captain: At the halfway stage, we weren't too disappointed. The wicket was the best to bat on when we started but those 4-5 wickets cost us. We don't want to use lack of experience as an excuse but they did look in rhythm and played very well. But the beauty of it is we will get another chance on Monday. We want to compete but do better than we did today, especially with the bat.

9:02pm: Bangladesh have their biggest ODI win of all time. They checked off all boxes with bat and ball. Hridoy and Shakib were brilliant, they set up the win. Stirling and Doheny started well but Ebadot and Taskin got to the party and never gave the visitors a sniff after that. Their consistent pace and ability to hit a good length or go back to a hard length challenged batters' edges and made scoring difficult. Ireland would be disappointed with their collapse after a good opening stand. Dockrell offered some resistance but apart from Campher, got very little support. Lots of soul searching remains for them between this and in two days.

commentTextItems.html: Makes room and slaps it, goes up off the bottom edge. Mid-off is in and has to run back, it goes too far.
Length around off, thick inside edge off the slightly open faced bat takes it to deep fine leg
Full toss outside off, open-faced push goes to point
Yorker around off, tries to drive and gets beaten

Litton covers ample ground, dives to the right but isn't able to take it at long-off. Made room and was Nasum tried to follow him, but gave some room. Lofted it straight. Great effort but goes past the man

commentTextItems.html: Makes room and connects with the cover drive again. Was another biff. Hit it off a length, raced along the ground
Makes room and tries to late cut a shortish ball over the stumps. Went hard and missed it.
Back of length at 119kph following the batter who made room. Flicked to midwicket
Bouncer around off, Dockrell crouches and goes for the pull. Beaten
High-ish full toss at the stumps. Makes room and slaps to deep cover. Replay shows it was close to a no-ball, not given.
Creams a slashing cover drive. Was a length ball with little room, Adair clears his front leg and smashes it
Clips the slightly short ball outside off, off the back foot to long-on.

dismissalText.commentary: Paul Stirling c Mushfiqur Rahim b Ebadot Hossain 22 (31b 1x4 1x6 54m) SR: 70.96

dismissalComment.html: terrific from the wicketkeeper Mushfiqur! Ebadot goes short on middle. Stirling swivels to pull but the ball gets big on him. He gets a glove and Mushfiqur has to throw his body to the left while sticking his hands out - and voila, he manages to do just that! Mushfiqur goes flying and that's a second brilliant glovework effort to send the other opener back for 22

dismissalText.long: c Yasir Ali b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Lorcan Tucker c Yasir Ali b Taskin Ahmed 6 (8b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Yessir, Yasir! Taskin follows the wicket maiden over with another wicket to start his next over. Tucker tucked up by a short-ish ball around off. He wanted to nurdle it leg side but the bat's face is closed, and the edge flies to first slip. Yasir had to move to his right with the ball flying, but he was up to the challenge!

headshotImage.longCaption: Nasum Ahmed player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Curtis Campher lbw b Nasum Ahmed 16 (17b 2x4 0x6 44m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: full ball on off and middle. Gets forward to defend, but the ball goes past the inside edge of the bat and hits his front leg. LBW appeal and given! Ireland review after a short chat. If there is no inside edge, this should be plumb. Campher looked to defend from an off-stump line but the angle of the delivery has made the ball hit him in front of middle. Bat is close to the ball on replay, but the technology doesn't suggest an edge. The TV umpire, though, wants a second angle to rule out bat. He says, "satisfied it is pad first".... and the replay shows the ball crashing into leg stump.

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasum Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Andy McBrine c Mushfiqur Rahim b Nasum Ahmed 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: coming over the stumps, and this is out down the leg side?! Bangladesh are reviewing. This was a length ball on middle that was turning down leg. But the batter attempted the flick, and the home side feels this is caught behind. Another terrific grab from Mushfiqur, if this is out. Keeper and bowler are convinced. And yes, there is a graze. Umpire Tucker has to change his decision. Nasum with a third!

milestones.description: Bangladesh's 183-run win against Ireland is the largest margin of victory in terms of runs in ODIs, beating 169-run win against Zimbabwe
